official.headline: Orderly Data Reset
official.anchor_line: A large number of residents participate in a citywide 'data strike,' updating their Behavioral Compliance Index—also known as BCI—profiles.
official.contextual_reframing: Thanks to advanced digital infrastructure, Stenograd ensures smooth identity management, even during periods of high citizen engagement.

official.headline: Service Response Steady
official.anchor_line: Minor interruptions in transit, health, and social welfare services have been promptly identified and addressed by our automated systems.
official.contextual_reframing: Systemic resilience guarantees that essential city services remain robust, safeguarding all citizens during digital transitions.

official.headline: Council Extends Dialogue
official.anchor_line: The Central Council invites citizen representatives to discuss new opportunities for digital cooperation.
official.contextual_reframing: Stenograd’s leadership is committed to transparency and inclusion, advancing harmony between technology and society.

underground.headline: System Loses Track
underground.anchor_line: Thousands just wiped their Behavioral Compliance Index records in a massive 'data strike'—now nobody knows who’s really who.
underground.contextual_reframing: The BCI runs your life here—every move, every right is tracked. This is what it looks like when the people pull the plug.

underground.headline: City In Chaos
underground.anchor_line: Transit stalls, clinics shut, welfare lines break as missing BCI profiles crash the system.
underground.contextual_reframing: When you vanish from the index, even basic services disappear. Stenograd’s digital chains are snapping—and neighbors are stepping up to help each other.

underground.headline: Council Forced To Talk
underground.anchor_line: Pressure rises—Council calls for talks after street art and protest spread across Stenograd.
underground.contextual_reframing: Usually, the system picks your leaders. This time, it’s citizen voices breaking through the algorithmic wall.
